definition: lit. to draw a line on the ground to keep within (idiom)/fig. to impose restrictions on oneself
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
limit/bound/to set a limit (on)

sentences.english: I have the ability to overcome all of obstacles and give all my heart to serve this world.
sentences.chinese: 开放自己的心不画地自限就能飞得更远。

definition: stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
complacent/self-satisfied
hidebound by convention (idiom)
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
idleness
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
self-/ego (psychology)
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
to use one's best efforts to do sth (idiom)
to be at a standstill/to mark time
to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition
to be unduly humble (idiom)/to undervalue oneself
variant of 意識形態|意识形态[yi4 shi2 xing2 tai4]
to act impetuously (idiom); on an impulse
to be a stickler for formalities/to rigidly adhere to/to cling to/constrained/ill at ease
lone flower admiring itself (idiom); narcissism/self-love
